command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Get the current known hosts either from those trusted by Posh-SSH or from a IStore.
Get the current known hosts either from those trusted by Posh-SSH, also from a Known Host IStore either from New-SSHMemoryKnownHost, Get-SSHJsonKnownHost or Get-SSHOpenSSHKnownHost.
Known Host IStore either from New-SSHMemoryKnownHost, Get-SSHJsonKnownHost or Get-SSHOpenSSHKnownHost.
HostName as stored by Posh-SSH or in a IStore.
HostName as stored by Posh-SSH or in a IStore.
Known Host IStore either from New-SSHMemoryKnownHost, Get-SSHJsonKnownHost or Get-SSHOpenSSHKnownHost.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-SSHTrustedHost
HostName HostKeyName Fingerprint -------- ----------- ----------- 192.168.1.165 ssh-ed25519 7a:da:ab:88:55:95:5b:34:89:f6:46:7f:13:c5:65:c1

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $inmem = New-SSHMemoryKnownHost PS C:\> $inmem.SetKey("192.168.1.1","Router","12:f8:7e:78:61:b4:bf:e2:de:24:15:96:4e:d4:72:53") True PS C:\> Get-SSHTrustedHost -KnowHostStore $inmem
HostName HostKeyName Fingerprint -------- ----------- ----------- 192.168.1.1 Router 12:f8:7e:78:61:b4:bf:e2:de:24:15:96:4e:d4:72:53

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get stored known hosts from an Memory Known Host store.

maml:description.maml:para: Establishes a Dynamic Port Forward thru a stablished SSH Session.

Dynamic port forwarding is a transparent mechanism available for applications, which support the SOCKS4 or SOCKS5 client protoco. In windows for best results the local address to bind to should be the IP of the network interface.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-SSHDynamicPortForward -LocalAdress 192.168.28.131 -LocalPort 8081 -Index 0 -Verbose VERBOSE: Finding session with Index 0 VERBOSE: 0 VERBOSE: Adding Forward Port Configuration to session 0 VERBOSE: Starting the Port Forward. VERBOSE: Forwarding has been started.

maml:description.maml:para: Redirects traffic from a local port to a remote host and port via a SSH Session.
Redirects TCP traffic from a local port to a remote host and port via a SSH Session.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Forward traffic from 0.0.0.0:8081 to 10.10.10.1:80 thru a SSH Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: PS C:\> New-SSHLocalPortForward -Index 0 -LocalAdress 0.0.0.0 -LocalPort 8081 -RemoteAddress 10.10.10.1 -RemotePort 80 -Verbose VERBOSE: Finding session with Index 0 VERBOSE: 0 VERBOSE: Adding Forward Port Configuration to session 0 VERBOSE: Starting the Port Forward. VERBOSE: Forwarding has been started.

maml:description.maml:para: Port forward a local port as a port on a remote server.
Port forward a local port as a port on a remote server. A connection on the remote host to the forwarded port will be redirected to the local host port.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Add a new trusted host for Posh-SSH to use.
Add a new trusted host for Posh-SSH to use. By default it will store the new host in the default Posh-SSH hosts.json file unless a KnownHost store is specified.
FQDN or IP address of the host.
SSH finger print for the the host to be added.
Known Host IStore either from New-SSHMemoryKnownHost, Get-SSHJsonKnownHost or Get-SSHOpenSSHKnownHost.
Friendly name for the key, in the case of OpenSSH it is the ciphers used.
SSH finger print for the the host to be added.
FQDN or IP address of the host.
Known Host IStore either from New-SSHMemoryKnownHost, Get-SSHJsonKnownHost or Get-SSHOpenSSHKnownHost.
Friendly name for the key, in the case of OpenSSH it is the ciphers used.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $inmem = New-SSHMemoryKnownHost PS C:\> New-SSHTrustedHost -KnowHostStore $inmem -HostName 192.168.1.165 -FingerPrint 3c:bf:26:9f:d9:63:d7:48:b8:fc:7b:32:e8:f9:5a:b4 -Name Pi

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add new host entry to a store.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove a KnwonHost entry from the default user location or from a KnownHost store.
Remove a KnwonHost entry from the default user location or from a KnownHost store.
Host name of the entry to remove.
Known Host IStore either from New-SSHMemoryKnownHost, Get-SSHJsonKnownHost or Get-SSHOpenSSHKnownHost.
Host name of the entry to remove.
Known Host IStore either from New-SSHMemoryKnownHost, Get-SSHJsonKnownHost or Get-SSHOpenSSHKnownHost.
Start a configured port forward configured for a SSH Session
Stops a configured port forward configured for a SSH Session given the session and port number

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Stop a currently working port forward thru a SSH Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: BoundHost : 192.168.1.158 BoundPort : 8081 Host : 10.10.10.1 Port : 80 IsStarted : False
BoundHost : 192.168.1.158 BoundPort : 8081 Host : 10.10.10.1 Port : 80 IsStarted : True

maml:description.maml:para: Stops a configured port forward configured for a SSH Session
Stops a configured port forward configured for a SSH Session given the session and port number

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Stop a currently working port forward thru a SSH Session

dev:remarks.maml:para: BoundHost : 192.168.1.158 BoundPort : 8081 Host : 10.10.10.1 Port : 80 IsStarted : True
BoundHost : 192.168.1.158 BoundPort : 8081 Host : 10.10.10.1 Port : 80 IsStarted : False
